HVAC Services

Hello there!

You just installed the Odoo for HVAC Services package. By doing so, we have installed a bunch of necessary apps to run your bar efficiently.

Discover the basics of this package and explore all the possibilities Odoo offers to improve your experience.

üí°

If you want to execute a practical guided tour of this module, you should Import demo data and try the Demo - Use Case (In the next Knowledge Article)


Basics

You can access every installed App in your Odoo database on your main dashboard.

  • Use the Sales App to record any new ordering.
  • The Project App and Field Service App will ensure a great follow up of every order and help you plan, execute and monitor installations, maintenance and repairs.
  • Manage your stock thanks to Inventory App and Purchase App.
  • Easily find installed devices from the Contact App thanks to warranty module.
  • Monitor refrigerant consumption and waste from the Field Service App.


Use case

By uploading this module's demo data, your database has been filled with a few products, sale orders and more.

You should be able to execute the following flows to have an overview of various flows you can quickly execute with this package using Odoo.

Of course, this is just an overview of the features included in this package. Feel free to add new apps, delete/modify demo data, and test everything around!

You didn't import demo data? You can still do it. Go to Apps > Industries > Upgrade your Bar & Pub package and check the related box


üìú Managing orders

From the Sales App, you can manage your orders.

Installation
  • You are ready to sign your first customers? To do so, open the Sales App, create a new order and the customer.
  • Fill in the form by creating or selecting a customer contact.
  • Select a quotation template to save time for an installation.
üí°

Save time preparing the quotation templates which correspond to your frequent segments!

  • Send your quotation for online signature.
  • Confirm the order to close your deal and then create and confirm the invoice to bill your customer.
Maintenance
  • Create anew sale order but this time select the Maintenance quotation template.
  • Select your customer and then add the serials of devices to be maintained.
  • Send and confirm the order for the maintenance to be running.

üéì Sales


üìÖ Planning and execute services 

The Field Service App is the place to plan and follow up work to be done on customer sites.

Planning tasks
  • Open the Field Service App and navigate to the To Schedule Tasks from the All Tasks menu.
  • Define the Planned Date and Assignee for those tasks.
‚úÖ

Note that maintenance tasks are defined as recurrent every year.
This means that once done, next year, a new task will be created automaically for you to plan!

  • You can open the Planning by User to appreciate the planned tasks for the coming weeks.
  • The map of interventions is as well available from the My Tasks menu, by default today's ones.
Executing tasks

Now Mike and Tom have some heavy duties as technicians...

  • They will open their tasks of the day to work on it from the Field Service App.
  • First they'll start the task which trigger a time counter.
  • Then the worksheet can be filled in while performing the work.
  • If working on some products other serialized products, they can add them in the Lots/Serial Numbers tab, so that this task would be part of the history of those devices as well. 
  • When consuming products during interventions, they can add it as well to the task from the Products smart button.
üí°

Note that if the Task field Under Warranty is checked, neither the time spent on this task nor the products would be charged to your customer.

  • Last but not least, they will confirm the delivery of the device, validating the delivery to customer from the smart button at the top of the screen.
  • When all is done, the task can be marked as done, which stops the time counter and fill in a timesheet input. 
    Alternatively to the time counter, they could directly create a new timesheet input in the Timesheet tab.
üì±

Odoo is supported on mobile as well!
Make sure your technicians install the Odoo Progressive Web App to access and manage their tasks when on customer's site.

Billing repair tasks

You can now see that the task is done. In the case of a repair, the time spent and consumed products can be billed to your customer.

  • Open the sale order for this repair, from the smart button at the top of the task.
  • Create an invoice, which will expense the reported timesheet inputs and products added.
  • Check the invoice and then confirm it for payment.

üéì Field Service


üì¶ Managing inventory and purchases 

Managing your stock and resupply to never get out of stock happens in the Inventory App, while the Purchase App focuses on transactions with your suppliers.

Replenishment rules

For most products, you might want to have at all time some available.

  • Open the Replenishment from Operations menu in the Inventory App.
  • See that replenishment rules are defined for some products, some are under an Auto trigger and some other are under a manual trigger.
  • For products which become low on stock and below the rule minimum, you can order some in a click.
    This creates a purchase order with the to order quantity with your best supplier
    Order some AC to prevent running out!
üí°

Auto trigger for replenishment rule runs once a day and automatically creates a purchase order with appropriate quantities that you only have to confirm.
This helps you not even to have to wonder whether to order or not those to keep your business running.

Manual purchase orders

Other products such as cleaner product might not be tracked and would be ordered when getting out of stock.

  • Open the Purchase App, where 2 new orders are in request for quotation stage.
    One comes from the auto replenishment rules and the other from your order request.
    There are two since you don't expect those products from the same supplier.
‚úÖ

Define for each product the list of potential supplier in the Purchase tab to leverage the replenishment rules.

    • Open the Third company purchase order and add a line for consumable products when you need, the Com Koil Cleaner in this case. Then confirm your purchase order and expect the delivery shortly!
    • Open now the Fourth company order and confirm it as well.
Receiving deliveries

Your supplier deliveries are here, it's time to validate them!

  • Open the open Receipts from the Inventory App Overview.
    Since you made two orders, you expect two receipts.
    • Open the Third Company order.
      If everything matches, validate the order!
    • Open now the Fourth Company order.
      Since those products come with serials, you need to input them. Click on the Details button for each line and fill in the serial numbers.
      Once done, you can validate the order.

Your stock is now at its best!

üí°

To save time and prevent typo mistake when inputing the serial number, you can install and leverage the Barcode App!

üîé Finding customer devices and their history 

Finding in a sec the devices at a customer location and accessing their operation history is paramount for your business. You can keep track of this at all time from the Contact App with relationships with Field Service App.

A customer call you for an incident on a device?

  • Open the Contact App and find your customer, Jessica Martinez in this case.
  • Open her Lots/Serial Numbers from the smart buttons at the top of the screen.
  • In the case of private customers, they might not have many devices like in Jessica's case.
    But if needed, you could leverage the search bar at the top!
  • Note that the first delivery date of this device to your customer is available for you to know whether or not is still is under warranty.
  • A maintenance indicator is here to help you know at first sight whether this device is under ongoing maintenance contract or not.
  • Open the serial to access its details information:
    • The Transfers lists you the deliveries of the device.
    • The Sales links the sale order for this device.
    • The Maintenance's links the sale order for Subscriptions of this device.
    • The Field Services gives you access to all tasks related to this device to capture the last maintenance and repair tasks.


üìä Monitoring refrigerant consumption 

From the Field Service App, you can monitor the consumed refrigerant products given heavy regulations apply to those products.

  • Open the Refrigerant Consumption report from the Reporting menu of the Field Service App.
  • Break down is available through time, by product and with "added" and "removed" distinction. This reporting relies on field service worksheets filled up by technicians.
üí°

Assign the Refrigerant category to refrigerant products you need to monitor from the Inventory or Sales Apps.

Only the products of this category are available for selection from the field service worksheet.
